senses.sense_definition: A diminutive of the male given names <w>Hugh</w> or <w>Hubert</w>.

examples.text: My uncle <w>Huey</w> tells the best stories at family gatherings.
They decided to call the baby <w>Huey</w> after his grandfather.

senses.sense_definition: An imaginary god believed by surfers to control the weather and create waves.

examples.text: The surfers prayed to <w>Huey</w> for better waves tomorrow.
It seems <w>Huey</w> has finally answered our requests for a swell.

senses.sense_definition: A nickname for the Bell UH-1 Iroquois, a utility military helicopter famous for its use during the Vietnam War.

examples.text: The soldiers could hear the loud chopping sound of a <w>Huey</w> approaching the landing zone.
During the rescue mission, the team was extracted by a <w>Huey</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A nickname for the Bell AH-1 Cobra, a dedicated attack helicopter.

examples.text: The <w>Huey</w> provided essential air support for the troops on the ground.
He was trained to pilot a <w>Huey</w> in combat situations.

senses.sense_definition: A general slang term for any helicopter.

examples.text: Look at that <w>huey</w> flying over the city skyline.
We took a <w>huey</w> to get to the remote island quickly.

senses.sense_definition: A town, village, or place of residence.

examples.text: They moved to a quiet <w>huey</w> away from the busy city life.
This <w>huey</w> is known for its beautiful old architecture.
